summary: Address mechanical clarity gaps in core rules chapters, focusing on DC guidance, Check procedures, combat mechanics, and Character Creation flow to improve Persona Fit and Practical Usability scores from 6.2 to target 8.0.

target_issues.description: DC guidelines lack concrete number ranges and context-specific guidance, leaving GMs uncertain about difficulty assignment
target_issues.improvement_goal: GMs can confidently assign DCs using concrete examples and decision trees
target_issues.success_metric: Add DC assignment flowchart and 10+ genre-varied worked examples with explicit DC reasoning

target_issues.description: Check resolution procedure lacks clear step-by-step breakdown; partial success outcomes leave too much to GM interpretation
target_issues.improvement_goal: Players and GMs can execute Checks using numbered procedural steps with clear outcome guidance
target_issues.success_metric: Add numbered Check procedure; include 3+ Partial Success examples per common scenario type

target_issues.description: Character creation optimization pathways unclear; attribute allocation guidance sparse for new players
target_issues.improvement_goal: Players can make informed character build choices without external optimization guides
target_issues.success_metric: Add attribute priority recommendations by archetype; include 'What This Means in Play' callouts

target_issues.description: Combat action economy described conceptually rather than procedurally; Resolve Clock advancement rates undefined
target_issues.improvement_goal: Players can plan tactical sequences using clear action economy rules and Clock advancement guidelines
target_issues.success_metric: Add Turn Structure summary table; define standard Clock tick rates (1-2 for success, etc.)

target_issues.description: Tags, Conditions, and Clocks interactions unclear; mechanical effects need quick reference
target_issues.improvement_goal: Players can quickly look up Tag/Condition mechanical effects during play
target_issues.success_metric: Add consolidated quick-reference table showing Tag-to-modifier mappings and Condition effects

modifications.instruction: Add a 'DC Decision Flowchart' showing: 1) Is this fiction-trivial? (Don't roll), 2) What's the baseline difficulty? (Use DC ladder), 3) What modifiers apply? (Tags, tools, time). Include worked examples for each DC tier with specific genre scenarios.
modifications.success_criteria: Flowchart answers 'What DC should I set?' in <30 seconds with clear decision points

modifications.instruction: Replace narrative explanation with numbered procedure: 1) Declare Intent and Approach, 2) GM assesses if Check needed, 3) Determine Attribute and modifiers, 4) Set DC, 5) Roll 4d6, 6) Calculate Margin, 7) Interpret Outcome. Add a single-page quick-reference box.
modifications.success_criteria: Check procedure fits on one page with numbered steps and margin calculation table

modifications.instruction: Add a 'Partial Success Toolkit' section with 10+ example complications organized by scenario type: Combat (take damage but succeed), Social (succeed with obligation), Exploration (succeed with time cost), Investigation (succeed with false lead). Each example should show the fictional situation and mechanical resolution.
modifications.success_criteria: GMs have concrete Partial Success options for 4+ scenario categories

modifications.instruction: Add 'Archetype Attribute Priorities' table showing recommended spreads for: Combatant (MIG/AGI), Face (PRE), Scholar (RSN), Generalist (balanced). Include 'What This Means in Play' callouts explaining how each priority affects gameplay.
modifications.success_criteria: Table shows 4+ archetypes with attribute recommendations and gameplay implications

modifications.instruction: Expand Rella example to include decision-point annotations: WHY each attribute was chosen, WHAT playstyle this enables, HOW this compares to alternative builds. Add a second worked example with different archetype (social/scholarly focus).
modifications.success_criteria: Two complete examples with annotated decision rationale covering different playstyles

modifications.instruction: Add 'Starter Skill Packages' sidebar with 3-4 recommended skill combinations for common archetypes. Include guidance on when to use pre-built packages vs custom selection.
modifications.success_criteria: Players can select skills in <5 minutes using provided packages

modifications.instruction: Add 'Turn Structure Summary' table showing: Action types (Strike, Maneuver, Set Up, Special), what each accomplishes, typical Attributes used, and Clock effects. Include turn order options (conversational, popcorn, initiative) with when to use each.
modifications.success_criteria: Players can look up any action type and its effects in <10 seconds

modifications.instruction: Add explicit Clock advancement guidelines: 'Standard Strike ticks 1-2 segments on Full Success, 1 on Partial. Critical Success may tick 2-3. Clock size guidelines: 4-segment for mooks, 6-segment for standard threats, 8-segment for bosses.' Include sizing examples.
modifications.success_criteria: GMs can size enemy Clocks and predict combat length within 1-2 rounds accuracy

modifications.instruction: Add 2-3 complete combat encounter examples showing: initiative determination, action sequences across 3+ rounds, Clock progression, Tag/Condition application, and resolution. Annotate tactical decisions.
modifications.success_criteria: Each example shows complete 3+ round combat with annotated tactical choices

modifications.instruction: Add 'Quick Reference: Tags & Conditions' table with columns: Name | Type | Mechanical Effect | Common Sources | Clearing Method. Include 15+ most common Tags and Conditions with explicit Edge/Burden effects.
modifications.success_criteria: Table covers 15+ Tags/Conditions with clear mechanical effects

modifications.instruction: Add explicit guidance: 'Tags typically grant +1 Edge when favorable, -1 Burden when unfavorable. Multiple Tags stack up to +/-2 cap. GMs may also adjust DC by 2 instead of applying Edge/Burden.' Include worked examples.
modifications.success_criteria: Tag mechanical effects are explicitly defined with stacking rules and DC alternative

execution_order.rationale: Highest priority issue affecting most personas; foundational for combat and other systems
Second-tier issues; character creation flows into actions/checks; combat builds on both
Reference material that supports chapters modified in phases 1-2

estimated_impact.expected_improvement: +1.5 to +2.0 points average across all personas (6.2 â†’ 8.0 target)
secondary_benefits: Improved persona_fit for tactician and power gamer archetypes
Enhanced rules_accuracy through explicit mechanical definitions

review_cycle_recommendation.rationale: Focus on personas who rated lowest on practical_usability and needed concrete numbers; skip high-fit storyteller personas
